description: From Old French detenir. Cognate with Italian detenere, Portuguese deter, Romanian de»õine, and Spanish detener.

verbs.description: detain (third-person singular simple present detains, present participle detaining, simple past and past participle detained)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To keep someone from proceeding by holding them back or making claims on their attention.
(transitive) To keep back or from; to withhold.
(transitive) To seize goods for official purposes.
